issue.title: node.declaration.gatherPossibleValues is not a function
issue.body:
After upgrading rollup-plugin-commonjs from 4.1.0 to 5.0.3 I start getting this error:

```
node.declaration.gatherPossibleValues is not a function
TypeError: node.declaration.gatherPossibleValues is not a function
    at callHasEffects (/Users/fabricio/calamar/open/controltower/node_modules/rollup/src/ast/nodes/shared/callHasEffects.js:51:23)
    at CallExpression.hasEffects (/Users/fabricio/calamar/open/controltower/node_modules/rollup/src/ast/nodes/CallExpression.js:29:10)
    at Node.hasEffects (/Users/fabricio/calamar/open/controltower/node_modules/rollup/src/ast/Node.js:58:32)
    at ParenthesizedExpression.hasEffects (/Users/fabricio/calamar/open/controltower/node_modules/rollup/src/ast/Node.js:58:32)
    at Node.hasEffects (/Users/fabricio/calamar/open/controltower/node_modules/rollup/src/ast/Node.js:58:32)
    at VariableDeclarator.hasEffects (/Users/fabricio/calamar/open/controltower/node_modules/rollup/src/ast/nodes/VariableDeclarator.js:54:33)
    at VariableDeclaration.hasEffects (/Users/fabricio/calamar/open/controltower/node_modules/rollup/src/ast/Node.js:54:27)
    at Module.run (/Users/fabricio/calamar/open/controltower/node_modules/rollup/src/Module.js:320:14)
    at /Users/fabricio/calamar/open/controltower/node_modules/rollup/src/Bundle.js:134:14
    at Array.forEach (native)
Type rollup --help for help, or visit https://github.com/rollup/rollup/wiki
```

I am still not sure if this is an issue with my config, with rollup or with rollup-plugin-commonjs, I will investigate it further and try to come up with a simplified test case, just pasting this here to raise a flag for now...

body:
From the subject, it sounds like you would want the generated bundle to not have semi-colons, is that correct? But the issue you're talking about looks more like the ability to import code that doesn't have semi-colons.

For the issue reported, it's possibly related to a bug mentioned in #1009

For generating a bundle with optional semi-colons, that's not a trivial thing to do and would probably have to include a large amount of rewriting to support it.

My subject was poorly chosen indeed (I am not a native English speaker). 

The problem is not only with rollup not adding semi colons at the end of functions. The same runtime TpyeError also occurs when a file that starts with `(` or `[` is concatenated after a file that does not uses semi colons.

A workaround could be to write a plugin that checks the first char of each file, and if it is a (square) bracket, adds a semi colon before. Or apply a strategy that always adds a semicolon between files (since empty instructions are allowed in js), even though the generated code would be less elegant.

Whatever the solution, I believe it would be better to solve it in Rollup's core instead of a plugin.

Note that I am not trying to argue whether not using semicolons is a bad thing. JavaScript was so poorly designed that it allows several syntaxes, all of which we now have to support...

Ah, yes! Maybe you could change the title of the issue to "Allow importing of modules that don't use semicolons". I think that would make it more clear.

Some other bundlers do as you suggest and always insert a semicolon between modules for just this reason. It does lead to empty statements but the minification step should remove them.

rename.to: Allow importing of modules that don't use semicolons

issue.title: iife: Missing semicolon in unnamed (default) exports
issue.body:
Hi guys,

First I'd like to thank everybody for their input on this project. I really like the simplicity it brings our projects.

We noticed a small 'issue' when using default exports that are unnamed. The function declaration turns into a var declaration, but rollup doesn't add a trailing semicolon to this function. Our JSHint gives us a warning on this and breaks our build process.

What is your take on this? Issue or not?

Use the following setup to reproduce this on rollupjs.org:

_main.js (entry module)_

``` js
import customName from './no-name-default-export.js';
customName( 'Hello moon!' );
```

_no-name-default-export.js_

``` js
export default function(msg) {
  console.log(msg);
}

```

<!--
Thanks for raising an issue! To help us help you, if you've found a bug please consider the following:

* If you can demonstrate the bug using the interactive http://rollupjs.org demo, please do.
* If that's not possible, perhaps because your bug involves plugins, we recommend creating a small repo that illustrates the problem.

Reproductions should be small, self-contained, correct examples – http://sscce.org. For example, if your bug isn't related to Gulp, **do not include Gulp in the repro**. (Side-note: if it *is* related to Gulp, this is the wrong issue tracker!) If possible, use a config file as it's the standard, favoured approach to using Rollup: https://github.com/rollup/rollup/wiki/Command-Line-Interface#using-a-config-file

Occasionally, this won't be possible, and that's fine – we still appreciate you raising the issue. But please understand that Rollup is run by unpaid volunteers in their free time, and we will prioritise bugs that follow these instructions.

If you have a stack trace to include, we recommend putting inside a `<details>` block for the sake of the thread's readability:

<details>
  <summary>Stack trace</summary>

  Stack trace goes here...
</details>
-->

issue.title: custom bundle including d3-hierarchy breaks in 0.36.1
issue.body:
First off, thanks for all the hard work that's been put into this library.

Updating to 0.36.1 has broken my build, which uses [rollup-plugin-node-resolve](https://github.com/rollup/rollup-plugin-node-resolve) to include the [d3-hierarchy](https://github.com/d3/d3-hierarchy#treemap) treemap generator. Here is a stripped down example repository that reproduces the error: https://github.com/davelandry/rollup-d3

issue.title: Automatic semicolon insertion
issue.body: Fixes #1004 and #1009 by adding semicolons where the programmer was either too lazy to do so, or believes that deliberately writing broken code is a good idea.

body:
Add leading semicolon before (function (global) {
for iife output.

Give a option to output leading semicolon instead trailing semicolon.
Trailing semicolon not compitable with Standard JS.

What about `void` @lygstate ? That's been my preference. Makes it up front and in your face that something is "different".

```javascript
void function () {} ()
```
